With the release of Bootstrap 5.3, the framework introduced the use of Flexbox for creating layouts. This documentation will guide you through the process of using Flexbox in Bootstrap 5.3 to create flexible and responsive layouts for your web projects. ### Objective and Scope The objective of this documentation is to provide step-by-step instructions on using Flexbox in Bootstrap 5.3 to create layouts. It covers the necessary requirements and pre-requisites, provides code snippets and commands, troubleshoots common issues, and offers best practices and recommendations for optimal performance. ### Requirements and Pre-requisites To follow along with this documentation, you will need the following: - Basic knowledge of HTML and CSS - Bootstrap 5.3 installed in your project - A text editor or an integrated development environment (IDE) ### Step-by-Step Instructions 1. Start by creating a new HTML file and linking the Bootstrap 5.3 CSS and JavaScript files. 2. Use the Bootstrap grid system to create a container and row for your layout. 3. Add columns within the row to define the layout structure. 4. Apply Flexbox classes to the columns to control their behavior. 5. Use Flexbox utilities to align and position content within the columns. 6. Test and adjust the layout as needed. ### Code Snippets and Commands Here are some code snippets and commands that you may find useful when working with Bootstrap 5.3 layouts with Flexbox: - To link the Bootstrap 5.3 CSS file: ```html ``` - To link the Bootstrap 5.3 JavaScript file: ```html ``` - To create a container and row: ```html

By following the step-by-step instructions provided in this documentation, you can leverage the power of Flexbox to design visually appealing and user-friendly websites. Remember to refer to the Bootstrap documentation and apply best practices for optimal results.
